snippet: The president told members of the Veterans of Foreign Wars that the same people opposed to the Iran nuclear pact were echoing some who were eager to go war with Iraq.
abstract: Pres Obama criticizes opponents of Iran nuclear agreement, likening them to those who advocated for invasion of Iraq; argues that diplomacy, rather than rush to armed conflict, presents best chance of preventing Iran from developing nuclear weapons; comments come in remarks to members of the Veterans of Foreign Wars.
lead_paragraph: The president told members of the Veterans of Foreign Wars that the same people opposed to the Iran nuclear pact were echoing some who were eager to go war with Iraq.

headline.main: In Speech to Veterans, Obama Says Iran Deal Is ‘Smarter’ Path to Take
headline.print_headline: In Speech to Veterans, Obama Says Iran Deal Is ‘Smarter’ Path to Take
